ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: This is a seminar course. I just spent 1.5 hours to attend the seminar on a weekly basis.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It's good and broaden my view about biostatistical research.
The seminar is well organized. Topics are interesting and popular. The only weakness is that I hope the seminar would be more frequent. Once a week is not enough.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor is very responsible.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Thank you for all of your hard work in preparing for these weekly seminars!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Forrest is a very nice and helpful person.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is beneficial to learn about the work being presently done by researchers in the field.

This seminar course is very helpful. I have learnt a lot in currently ongoing research projects. I have got the chance to meet and talk to excellent researchers nationwide. I would definitely recommend it to other student.
this course could broaden one's horizons by introducing different professors' fields of study
